title: Iyer Brothers drew from a vast repertoire of compositions at their veena concert - The Hindu
summary:
Iyer Brothers Showcase Rich Veena Repertoire at Margazhi Festival

Published: January 08, 2025 05:28 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The Iyer Brothers, Ramnath and Gopinath, delivered a remarkable concert at the Kartik Fine Arts Margazhi festival 2024, showcasing their expertise and diverse repertoire of veena compositions.

  • The concert featured compositions such as Pallavi Gopala Iyer’s challenging Thodi varnam.
  • Muthuswamy Dikshitar’s ‘Mahaganapatim’ captivated with its swarakalpana section.
  • The brothers displayed their distinct techniques learned from renowned tutors.
  • The evening's main attraction was a Kalyani raga performance of ‘Etavunara’.
  • The recital concluded with Lalgudi Jayaraman's thillana in Mishra Shivaranjani.
“The brothers possess a vast repertoire, thanks to their tutelage under stalwarts such as R. Pichumani Iyer and Trivandrum R. Venkataraman.”

The Iyer Brothers' performance not only highlighted their technical skills but also their ability to engage the audience, reinforcing their reputation in the world of classical music.
newTitle: Iyer Brothers Showcase Rich Veena Repertoire at Margazhi Festival

title: Amazon launches Alexa-powered smart alarm clock Echo Spot in India - The Hindu
summary:
Amazon launches Alexa-powered smart alarm clock Echo Spot in India

Published: January 08, 2025 03:32 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

Amazon has launched the Echo Spot, an Alexa-powered smart alarm clock in India, featuring a customizable display and various audio capabilities.

  • Echo Spot has a 2.83 inch customizable touch screen and six different color themes.
  • It features a 1.73 inch front-firing speaker for playing music, podcasts, and audiobooks.
  • Users can set routines and automate tasks with voice commands through Alexa.
  • The device is priced at ₹8,999, with a special introductory offer of ₹6,449.
  • Available in Black and Blue, it includes features like ultrasound motion detection and the ability to make audio calls.
“Through our range of devices, we constantly strive to add more convenience and comfort to our customers’ daily lives,” said Parag Gupta, Director and Country Manager, Amazon Devices India.

This launch enhances Amazon's range of Alexa-enabled devices, aimed at improving user experience in smart homes.

title: OnePlus 13 series smartphones first to support Jio 5.5G network in India; offers over 1 Gbps download speed - The Indian Express
summary:
OnePlus 13 series smartphones first to support Jio 5.5G network in India; offers over 1 Gbps download speed

Publication Date: Tuesday

Source: Indian Express

OnePlus launched its new flagship smartphones, the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R, which are the first in India to support the Jio 5.5G network, facilitating download speeds exceeding 1 Gbps.

  • OnePlus 13 series is the first to incorporate Jio's upgraded Component Carrier Aggregation (3CC) 5G technology.
  • Speed demonstration showed a jump from 277.78 Mbps on regular 5G to 1,014.86 Mbps on Jio 5.5G.
  • 5.5G technology enables connections to multiple network cells simultaneously for enhanced performance.
  • No additional settings are needed for accessing the 5.5G network with compatible devices.
“Cutting-edge 5.5G technology allows your OnePlus 13 series device to connect to three different network cells, possibly even on different towers at the same time, for faster connectivity and better overall performance.” - James Paterson, Senior Global PR Manager, OnePlus

This advancement in mobile technology promises significantly faster download speeds and improved reliability for users in India.
newTitle: OnePlus 13 Series Launches with Jio 5.5G Support in India

title: Apple to improve AI news alerts feature after BBC complaint - The Hindu
summary:
Apple to Improve AI News Alerts Feature After BBC Complaint

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: Reuters

Apple has announced plans to improve its AI news alerts feature following complaints about inaccurate summaries, particularly highlighted by incidents involving incorrect news alerts.

  • The AI news alerts feature has faced criticism for summarizing news inaccurately, leading to misinformation being disseminated.
  • Specific examples include incorrect alerts regarding a murder suspect and false claims about tennis player Rafael Nadal.
  • Apple plans to roll out a software update in the coming weeks to clarify the summaries generated by Apple Intelligence.
  • The feature is currently in beta, available on iPhone 16, 15 Pro, 15 Pro Max, and some iPads and Macs.
  • Users are encouraged to report any concerns or inaccurate alerts they encounter.
“Apple is developing a software update to ‘further clarify’ these news alerts summaries generated by Apple Intelligence.”

In conclusion, Apple is taking steps to address the issues with its AI-powered news alerts in response to user feedback and complaints, emphasizing the importance of accurate information dissemination.
newTitle: Apple to Enhance AI News Alerts Following BBC Complaints

title: OnePlus launches 180 days phone replacement plan, available for OnePlus 13 - India Today
summary:
OnePlus Launches 180-Day Phone Replacement Plan for OnePlus 13 and 13R

Published On: Jan 8, 2025 | Source: India Today

OnePlus has announced a new phone replacement plan exclusively for its flagship OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R smartphones, applicable to purchases made before February 13, 2025.

  • The free replacement offer is valid within the first 180 days of purchase for hardware issues.
  • Customers must visit an authorized service center to confirm eligibility for a replacement device.
  • After the free period, users can opt for a paid protection plan at differing prices: Rs 2,599 for OnePlus 13 and Rs 2,299 for OnePlus 13R.
  • The OnePlus 13 is priced at Rs 69,999 and the OnePlus 13R at Rs 42,999, both available with bank discounts.
“We are proud to introduce this protection plan, further enhancing the user experience,” said Robin Liu, CEO of OnePlus India.

This new plan aims to provide better service and reliability for customers, reflecting OnePlus's confidence in their products.
newTitle: OnePlus Launches 180-Day Phone Replacement Plan for OnePlus 13 and 13R

title: Panasonic Z95B Series OLED TV, W95B Series Mini LED TV and W70B Series Smart TV unveiled at CES 2025 - FoneArena
[CES 2025] Home of the Future: Samsung Redefines the Standard for Smart Homes - samsung.com
CES 2025: 5 TV innovations that caught our attention - Digit
summary:
CES 2025: 5 TV Innovations That Caught Our Attention

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Digit

As expected, we saw a number of exciting TV updates at CES 2025. From advancements in OLED technology to the integration of artificial intelligence, manufacturers showcased their latest developments.

  • LG’s New Stacked White OLED: LG introduced a new OLED TV lineup featuring a four-stack Tandem OLED design for enhanced brightness, achieving peak brightness of approximately 1800 nits.
  • Samsung’s New QD-OLED Panel: The S95F model offers a remarkable peak brightness of up to 4000 nits, enhancing colour accuracy and brightness with Quantum Dot technology.
  • Samsung’s Stretchable Display: A prototype that can expand and contract without losing image quality, signaling new possibilities in TV design.
  • RGB Mini LED Backlight: Hisense launched a TriChroma backlight offering up to 10,000 nits of peak brightness with 97% BT2020 coverage.
  • AI Integration in TVs: Samsung Vision AI enhances user interaction with features like 'Click to Search' and 'Live Translate'.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“AI-driven personalisation tailors content recommendations and optimises picture and sound settings based on viewing habits.”

This reflects a broader industry movement towards making televisions central hubs in connected smart homes.

Overall, CES 2025 highlighted significant advancements in TV technology, showcasing how innovation is reshaping the viewing experience.
newTitle: CES 2025: 5 TV Innovations That Caught Our Attention
